CatDescriptText: Mrs. Christine Hill, student, Hill District and Mr. Calvin Reed, maintenance man, Homewood, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 21, 1962, pg. 17 with question: "Do you approve of the United States testing nuclear weapons in the atmosphere?"  Mrs. Hill's answer reads: "No, I don't.  I don't see where it's accomplishing anything."  Mr. Reed's answer reads: "No, It's not doing any good."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Christine Hill wearing dark dress with button down bodice, standing in front of C.A. Michel store with Pittsburgh Paints sign, Smithfield Street, Downtown; Portrait of Calvin Reed wearing short sleeve button down collared shirt and eyeglasses, standing in front of C.C. Mellor Co., Smithfield Street, Downtown
